00018 #ifndef __TLM_PEQ_H__
00019 #define __TLM_PEQ_H__
00020 
00021 #include <map>
00022 #include "tlm_h/tlm_peq/tlm_write_if.h"
00023 
00024 namespace tlm {
00025 
00026 //
00027 // No lt_sc_time operator required, since we have operator< defined for
00028 // sc_time ?
00029 //
00030 // struct lt_sc_time {
00031 //  bool operator<( const sc_core::sc_time &a , const sc_core::sc_time &b ) {
00032 //    return a < b;
00033 //  }
00034 // };
00035 //
00036 //
00037 //
00038 
00039 //
00040 // This peq implements a delayed write and has an write port
00041 //
00042 // If you post many transactions to the same time slot, this will result in
00043 // many transactions coming out of the write port in a single delta
00044 //
00045 // If you want event driven semantics, stuff the output of the write port
00046 // into a fifo ( if you want to guarantee no losses ) or
00047 // buffer ( if you don't mind losses but you can't be bothered or are
00048 // not able to clear the fifo out ).
00049 //
00050 // For example, you can arrive at a blocking get interface by doing get on
00051 // a fifo attached to the write port shown below
00052 //
00053 // We could even design a tlm_peq_fifo and/or tlm_peq_buffer with these
00054 // channels built in
00055 //
00056 
00057 template< typename T>
00058 class tlm_peq :
00059   public sc_core::sc_module ,
00060   public virtual tlm_delayed_write_if< T >
00061 {
00062  public:
00063   sc_core::sc_export< tlm_delayed_write_if< T > > delayed_write_export;
00064   sc_core::sc_port< tlm_write_if< T > > write_port;
00065 
00066   SC_HAS_PROCESS( tlm_peq );
00067 
00068   tlm_peq( sc_core::sc_module_name nm ) :
00069     sc_core::sc_module( nm ) , write_port("write_port") {
00070 
00071     delayed_write_export( *this );
00072 
00073     SC_METHOD( wake_up_method );
00074     dont_initialize();
00075     sensitive << m_wake_up;
00076 
00077   }
00078 
00079   int size() const { return m_map.size(); }
00080 
00081   int posted_before( const sc_core::sc_time &time ) const {
00082 
00083     int i = 0;
00084 
00085     for( typename std::multimap< sc_core::sc_time , T>::const_iterator iter = m_map.begin();
00086          iter != m_map.end();
00087          ++iter ) {
00088 
00089       if( (*iter).first < time ) {
00090         i++;
00091       }
00092 
00093     }
00094 
00095     return i;
00096 
00097   }
00098 
00099   int posted_at( const sc_core::sc_time &time ) const {
00100     return m_map.count( time );
00101   }
00102 
00103   void write( const T &transaction , const sc_core::sc_time &time ) {
00104 
00105     m_map.insert( pair_type( time + sc_core::sc_time_stamp() , transaction ) );
00106     m_wake_up.notify( time );
00107 
00108   }
00109 
00110  private:
00111   typedef std::pair<sc_core::sc_time,T> pair_type;
00112 
00113   void wake_up_method() {
00114 
00115     pair_type p;
00116     sc_core::sc_time now = sc_core::sc_time_stamp();
00117 
00118     // must be something there, and it must be scheduled for now
00119 
00120     assert( m_map.size() > 0 );
00121     assert( (*(m_map.begin())).first == now );
00122 
00123     for( p = *(m_map.begin());
00124          p.first == now;
00125          p = *(m_map.begin()) )
00126     {
00127 
00128       write_port->write( p.second );
00129       m_map.erase( m_map.begin() );
00130 
00131       if( m_map.size() == 0 ) {
00132         return;
00133       }
00134 
00135       p = *(m_map.begin());
00136 
00137     }
00138 
00139     m_wake_up.notify( p.first - now );
00140 
00141   }
00142 
00143   sc_core::sc_event m_wake_up;
00144   std::multimap< sc_core::sc_time , T> m_map;
00145 
00146 };
00147 
00148 } // namespace tlm
00149 
00150 #endif
